reviews.text: As detailed in other reviews the location of this hotel is perfect, right on the Liverpool ONE development.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, but no Pool.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is next door to the Liverpool ONE bus station which has buses directly to the airport (current cost GBP2.70 one way). It is also a 10 min walk from the Pier Head landing stage, very convenient for ferry travellers from the Isle of Man. Lime Street and the central rail stations are 10/15 mins walk away.
reviews.title: we ll never be back

reviews.text: Shame there is no pool at this flagship hotel. The nearby Novotel has one as does the Crowne Plaza. There is a gym though.
reviews.title: Recomended

reviews.text: Rooms are of good size with large bathrooms for a city centre hotel.
reviews.title: Mixed Stay - Some Good and Some Bad

reviews.text: The 32" LCD TV has BBC HD and the normal range of UK free to air channels.
reviews.title: Great in many ways. Really lovely hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights on a deal that included breakfast, a meal on the first night and a bottle of wine between two. The room was very comfortable with everything you needed. Staff were very helpful. At breakfast you had an excellent choice. The hotel is so conveniently situated. We thought parking would be a problem but we were told to park in the Q Car Park next to the hotel.It turned out to be simple and Hilton guests get a small discount. When we return to Liverpool we will be booking this hotel again.
reviews.title: Brilliant

reviews.text: The rooms were big and spacious and the kids had a lot of room to play around in. Breakfast in the mornings was always wonderful with a decent menu and the same can be said for dinner. The hotel is situated near anything you could possibly want to do in Liverpool. Usual hilton quality through out.
reviews.title: Family loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights on a travelzoo deal that included breakfast, a meal on the first night and a bottle of wine. We also upgraded to an executive room so had access to the executive lounge.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a great city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself was great, it was a very modern Hilton, with a great bar. It is also in a brilliant location.
reviews.title: Fanstastic Hotel, friendly staff & top service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was also great. We were really pleased with it - there was a few niggles over things that should have been in the room (dressing gowns etc) but this was a really small issue and no real problem.
reviews.title: Excellent location, great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a one night stay and can say without reservation that we will return. On arrival we were greeted by Sabrina on the front desk who was absolutely fantastic with us - I had given up on customer service in this country but this has restored my faith. Beautiful bar area which makes a nice change for corporate hotels - Hilton has defo got it spot on here!
reviews.title: Excellent in every way

reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights in April with my daughter. The room was excellent - very modern, luxurious beds and a great view overlooking the Albert Dock. We got Liverpool Explorer passes included in our package which gave us free admission to the Beatles' story and the Mersey Ferry. Breakfasts were fabulous (the bacon is lovely) and staff were so polite and helpful. Would definitely recommend.
reviews.title: Hi spec modern accommodation, excellent location, helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed for 1 night. We booked the hotel because it was close to the venue where Britains Got Talent was being held. Great customer service, room clean, facilities great. The executive lounge had great views. Lots of eating places close by. Had a great meal at the Spice Club.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel. Have booked to return in September

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in Hilton Liverpool for 2 nights with my boyfriend to do some Christmas shopping. The hotel is beautiful and well situated, close to all the shops and nightlife. Ordered room service for breakfast but the order had been mixed up. tt was sorted very quick and we weren't charged the room service fee which was a nice touch. All in all a great hotel and we will defintely not stay anywhere else when in Liverpool.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel
Outstanding Hilton experience. Best one we have stayed in up to now.
reviews.text: Other Hilton hotels need to take a page out of this hotel's book. In fact other hotels in general do! We were very pleased at this exceptional hotel. The location was excellent - right in the heart of all of the action and we had great views of the docks and Liverpool 1 shopping area from our 5th floor room. In room amenities were top class also with audio in the bathroom that linked directly to the TV so we could pop the TV onto Radio made and listen whilst in the shower. Very nice touch.

Great place to stay visiting this fab city.Friendly staff,concierge was a friendly helpfull Liverpudlian.Great place to stay in this great city.We are looking forward to visiting Liverpool again and will book the Hilton
reviews.title: Friendly Staff,good size rooms,huge bed,great location

reviews.text: As the title says, I booked 5 rooms at the Hilton for my hen party last saturday night. So glad I did as everyone commented on how much they liked it.
reviews.title: Fantastic hen party stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Myself and mum's room was one of the front corner ones, with great views over the docks infront and Liverpool One to the side - not sure if we got it because it was obvious that it was my party, but it was a great bonus.
reviews.title: Great location, friendly staff, comfortable rooms

reviews.text: I was a little worse for wear to enjoy much breakfast but the selection was good with eggs cooked to order and the service was friendly. The bar opened late so we called in for a couple as we headed home - very modern and great music/lighting but drink were expensive, £5 for a vodka and coke.
reviews.title: Great location, friendly staff and quality room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All staff at the hotel were very friendly and approachable, particularly the doormen/concierge who were on hand with lots of suggestions. As has been said previously, you can't fault the location, it was perfect for us - we even popped back half way through our night out to change into more sensible footwear : )
reviews.title: Hilton - Not worth the money or the good reputation!
